channel.title: Programming on Volcano and Fault Mechanics
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Volcano and Fault Mechanics

item.title: 3D-DEF code and manual/tutorial (.pdf)
item.description: Recently, I encountered a ground deformation problem where the slip along a particular fault seems not partitioned (distributed) as usual. Most of the elastic dislocation codes assume that slip partitions about half of the slip on one side block (hangingwall) and the other half along the other block (footwall), e.g., the popular Okada codes. These codes will not work when slip occurs only due to the motion of one block. This is basically the problem I want to study, for this you need more advance and flexible programs, one of those is 3D-DEF.
